intro: Psychotria brevipes, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is known for containing alkaloids, including cocaine, which is extracted from its leaves. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant cultural and medicinal importance in indigenous communities.
